item.title: How to use a LLM to upgrade your project
item.author: diegojromerolopez@gmail.com (Diego J. Romero-López)
item.description: How to use a LLM to upgrade your project In this post we pick up a Python 2.0 project and show how to use a LLM to upgrade a software project. Introduction I will upgrade the Djanban project as it should be done. Not only making it work with the latest versions of the software packages, but improving its quality and making sure there are guardrails that make impossible for the developers

item.title: How NOT to use a LLM to upgrade your project
item.author: diegojromerolopez@gmail.com (Diego J. Romero-López)
item.description: How NOT to use a LLM to upgrade your project In this post we pick up a Python 2 project and show how NOT to use a LLM to upgrade an outdated software project. This is a two-series go to the next post if you are only interested in how to do it correctly. Introduction I created the Djanban project 9 years ago. At that time I was studying a Master’s degree in Software Project Management by the Technical University of Madrid.

item.title: Use MCPs with local LLMs
item.author: diegojromerolopez@gmail.com (Diego J. Romero-López)
item.description: Use MCPs with local LLMs This post will show you how to run local Large Language Models (LLMs) with some useful Model Context Protocols (MCPs) to power up your performance while developing software. Conclusion You can leverage MCPs with local LLMs to have local-AI in your MacBook Pro M1 laptop.
